documents.title: thousands sign up to neighbourhood watch scheme
text: derbyshire is home to the largest neighbourhood watch team in the country .

documents.title: council to cut £ 34m from budget
text: derbyshire county council has set out how it intends to cut £ 34m from its budget in the coming financial year .
adult social care faces a cut just short of £ 7m , with children 's services to be cut by more than £ 6m .
the council said it 's facing severe funding cuts from the government , while the tory opposition has said the authority could cancel the majority of this year 's cuts by taking money from reserves .
author: Wesley Mallin
Reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: two branches around county affected
text: two branches around derbyshire - in alfreton and castle donington - will also close .
the company has blamed the closures partly on the growth of mobile and internet banking .
the move is expected to lead to 180 redundancies .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rolls-royce downgraded by s & p
text: the agency s & p ( standard and poor 's ) has downgraded derby-based rolls royce 's credit rating .
last week it was announced the aero-engine maker would have to pay more than £ 670m to settle bribery and corruption cases .
the agency now rates rolls-royce as triple b plus , rather than a minus , but said the company 's outlook was stable .
author: Rory Gallimore
BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: erewash mp : 'modern slavery is happening '
text: after two men were convicted yesterday for conning and threatening workers who went to work at sports direct , erewash mp maggie throup said : `` i think it can make more people aware that modern slavery is happening .
`` it 's happening every day in all sorts of environments that we do n't think about , so hopefully it will be put in people 's minds a lot more . ''

documents.title: donington 's chequered f1 past
text: a deal to bring the british grand prix to donington collapsed eight years ago when the company redeveloping the circuit failed to show it had the £ 135m funding required .
donington has hosted f1 before - the 1993 european grand prix ( - which was won by ayrton senna .

BBC Local Live

text: i 've been told hopes that a british grand prix could come to donington park are nothing but a pipe dream at the moment .
why are we talking about this now ?

documents.title: haslam 'disappointed ' at missing honda launch
text: despite all the broken bones , haslam said the biggest disappointment was missing out on riding a new type of honda motorcycle .
`` i was looking forward to it that much it was incredible , '' he said .
`` it was like counting down to christmas . ''
author: Jonathan Baker
Reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: ex-world champion speaks out following crash
text: former world champion motorcycle racer ron haslam said he 's looking forward to getting back to riding - despite breaking his collarbone , ribs and puncturing his lung 10 days ago when he fell off a pit bike .
author: Jonathan Baker
Reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: police trying to trace 'dangerous ' driver
text: police are trying to trace a car that was being `` driven dangerously '' on the a6 last wednesday .
at about 16:20 , a dark coloured audi was seen driving along the southbound carriageway of the a6 taddington bypass in the direction of ashford in the water .
the car - reported to be either an a3 or a4 model - cut in front of a driver who was overtaking a lorry , narrowly avoiding a serious collision , derbyshire police said .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man charged after holiday park 'stabbing '
text: a man has been charged after a 47-year-old man was reportedly stabbed at a holiday park .
james andrew shenton , 40 , was arrested at gateway caravan park in osmaston on saturday , after it was reported a man from belper had been stabbed , derbyshire police said .
the force said the injured man is recovering in hospital after being treated for `` serious '' injuries .
mr shenton was charged with wounding with intent and is due in court on 20 february .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: charity calls for horse microchip law enforcement
text: the help for horses charity is calling for authorities to start enforcing the law which requires horses to be microchipped .
the law states horses born after 2009 must be microchipped .
the calls come after the bodies of three horses were found abandoned in a field near little eaton island last wednesday .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'it 'll be a unique product for the uk '
text: mr hunter said : `` it 's a significant opportunity for us and our competitors to secure that new train fleet .
it 's something we are working very hard on .
`` it 'll be a unique product for the uk so it will require some very special developmental engineering , but we 're engaging in that process at the moment to play a part in the bidding process . ''
author: Khia Lewis-Todd

documents.title: could bombardier build trains for hs2 ?
text: bombardier 's managing director , richard hunter , has confirmed the train maker is already working on its bid to build trains for the hs2 .
the contract announced last week will be worth £ 2.5bn .
bidding will open in 2018 for the deal , which is for 60 trains and an ongoing maintenance contract .
author: Sally Swinfen
BBC Radio Derby newsreader
